| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | io | Latin | ego | | essere | Latin | esse | | a + il | Latin | ad + ille | | terzo | Latin | tertius | | cerchio | Greek | κύκλος (kuklos) | | di | Latin | de | | la | Latin | illa | | pioggia | Latin | pluvia | | eterno | Latin | aeternus | | maledetto | Latin | maledictus | | freddo | Germanic | *kaldaz* | | e | Latin | et | | greve | Latin | gravis | | regola | Latin | regula | | e | Latin | et | | qualità | Latin | qualitas | | mai | Latin | magis | | non | Latin | non | | le | Latin | illae | | essere | Latin | esse | | nuovo | Latin | novus |
**Note:**
* The etymology of "terzo" is uncertain, but it is possibly derived from the Latin "tertius" or the Etruscan "terza." * The etymology of "cerchio" is from the Greek "κύκλος" (kuklos), meaning "circle." * The etymology of "freddo" is from the Germanic "*kaldaz*," meaning "cold." * The etymology of "greve" is from the Latin "gravis," meaning "heavy." * The etymology of "regola" is from the Latin "regula," meaning "rule." * The etymology of "qualità" is from the Latin "qualitas," meaning "quality." * The etymology of "mai" is from the Latin "magis," meaning "more." * The etymology of "non" is from the Latin "non," meaning "not."
